wikipedia_page.main:
Robert Henry Metge  (1850 – 19 September 1900) was an Irish Home Rule League politician.
He was elected as a Member of Parliament (MP) for Meath in 1880, but resigned the seat on 30 July 1883.His second wife Lillian Margaret Metge was a leading suffragette. After his premature death, she was arrested for causing an explosion, damaging the Cathedral in Lisburn.
